intro: Leptotes minuta, commonly known as the small-leaved piper, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Piperaceae, which includes other species of piper plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Leptotes minuta is often found in the understory of forests, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
